data.name: SecurityPermissionsDescription
data.value: Here you can set the permissions for your department, for example which users or roles can create calls, or who is authorized to create and remove users. Changes to the permissions will take effect on the next login to the Resgrid web application.

data.name: TwoFactorEnforcementDescription
data.value: Require authenticator-app 2FA for admin users. When enabled, admins who have not set up 2FA will be redirected to enroll before accessing administrative features.

data.name: Require2FAForAdminsDescription
data.value: Controls which admin-level users must enroll in authenticator-app 2FA (Google Authenticator, Microsoft Authenticator, Authy, etc.).

data.name: Require2FAAllAdmins
data.value: Department Admins + Managing User + Group Admins

data.name: Require2FACannotEnableNoManagingUser2FA
data.value: Cannot enable 2FA enforcement: the managing user of this department does not have two-factor authentication enabled on their account. The managing user must enable 2FA before this setting can be turned on.

data.name: Require2FACannotEnableNoCurrentUser2FA
data.value: Cannot enable 2FA enforcement: you do not have two-factor authentication enabled on your own account. You must enable 2FA before you can require it for others.

data.name: Require2FABothMustEnable
data.value: Cannot enable 2FA enforcement: neither you nor the managing user have two-factor authentication enabled. Both must enable 2FA before this setting can be turned on.

data.name: Require2FASettingLocked
data.value: This setting is locked until the above conditions are met.

data.name: SecurityDescription
data.value: Here you can set the permissions for your department, for example which users or roles can create calls, or who is authorized to create and remove users. Changes to the permissions will take effect on the next login to the Resgrid web application.

data.name: PermAddUsersNote
data.value: This option determines who can add users/personnel to the department. By default only Department Administrators (and the managing member) can add users. But Group Admins can also be allowed to add users (limited only to the group they are an admin of).

data.name: PermRemoveUsersNote
data.value: This option determines who can remove users/personnel from the department. By default only Department Administrators (and the managing member) can remove users. But Group Admins can also be allowed to remove users (limited only to the users in the group they are an admin of).

data.name: PermCreateCallNote
data.value: This option determines who can manually create calls from the Resgrid system. By default Everyone can create calls.

data.name: PermDeleteCallNote
data.value: This option determines who can delete calls from the Resgrid system. By default Everyone can delete calls.

data.name: PermCloseCallNote
data.value: This option determines who can close calls from the Resgrid system. By default Everyone can close calls.

data.name: PermAddCallDataLabel
data.value: Who can Add Data To Calls

data.name: PermAddCallDataNote
data.value: This option determines who can add data; like images, notes and files, to calls from the Resgrid system. By default Everyone can add data to calls.

data.name: PermCreateTrainingNote
data.value: This option determines who can create trainings. By default only Department Admins can create trainings.

data.name: PermCreateDocumentNote
data.value: This option determines who can add documents. By default Everyone can add documents.

data.name: PermCreateCalendarEntryNote
data.value: This option determines who can create calendar entries. By default Everyone can create calendar entries.

data.name: PermCreateNoteNote
data.value: This option determines who can create notes. By default Everyone can create notes.

data.name: PermCreateLogNote
data.value: This option determines who can add log entries. By default Everyone can add log entries.

data.name: PermCreateShiftNote
data.value: This option determines who can create and edit shifts. By default only Department Admins can create and edit shifts.

data.name: PermViewPersonalInfoNote
data.value: This option determines who can view personal information (PII) about personnel in the system. For example: Email Address, Phone Numbers, etc. By default Everyone can view this information.

data.name: PermAdjustInventoryNote
data.value: This option determines who can adjust inventory levels in the system. By default Everyone can adjust inventory.

data.name: PermViewPersonnelLocationLabel
data.value: Who can see the Location of Personnel

data.name: PermViewPersonnelLocationNote
data.value: This option determines who can see the location of personnel on the maps. To lock the option to just group admins and roles within a group you need to check the Group Only option.

data.name: PermViewUnitLocationLabel
data.value: Who can see the Location of Units

data.name: PermViewUnitLocationNote
data.value: This option determines who can see the location of units on the maps. To lock the option to just group admins and roles within a group you need to check the Group Only option.

data.name: PermCreateMessageNote
data.value: This option determines who can create and send messages (in-system mail). By default everyone can create and send messages.

data.name: PermViewGroupsUsersNote
data.value: By default all users can see all other users in the system. This option allows you to limit who can see users in the system.

data.name: PermViewGroupsUnitsNote
data.value: By default all users can see all units in the system. This option allows you to limit who can view units in the system.

data.name: PermViewContactsNote
data.value: By default all users can see all contacts in the system. This option allows you to limit who can view contacts in the system. If a user cannot view Contacts they also won't be able to add them to a call.

data.name: PermEditContactsLabel
data.value: Who can edit or create Contacts

data.name: PermEditContactsNote
data.value: By default all users can create and edit contacts in the system. This option allows you to limit who can create or edit contacts in the system.

data.name: PermDeleteContactsNote
data.value: By default all users can delete contacts in the system. This option allows you to limit who can delete contacts in the system.

data.name: PermCreateWorkflowNote
data.value: This option determines who can create, edit, and delete workflows and workflow steps. By default only Department Admins can manage workflows.

data.name: PermManageWorkflowCredentialsNote
data.value: This option determines who can create, edit, and delete encrypted credentials used by workflow actions (e.g., SMTP passwords, API keys). By default only Department Admins can manage credentials.

data.name: PermViewWorkflowRunsNote
data.value: This option determines who can view workflow execution history, run logs, and health dashboards. By default only Department Admins can view workflow runs.

data.name: SsoSingleSignOnDescription
data.value: Allow department members to log in with their existing corporate identity (Microsoft Entra ID, Okta, Google Workspace, etc.) instead of a separate Resgrid password.

data.name: SsoOidcDescription
data.value: OIDC — Modern protocol, ideal for Entra, Okta, Auth0, Google

data.name: SsoSamlDescription
data.value: SAML 2.0 — Widely supported by government & enterprise IdPs

data.name: SsoScimDescription
data.value: Automatically sync users from your identity provider. When you onboard or offboard staff in your corporate directory, Resgrid reflects those changes automatically — no manual invite/remove steps.

data.name: SsoScimAutoCreate
data.value: Auto-create new members when added in your IdP

data.name: SsoScimSyncNames
data.value: Keep names & email addresses in sync

data.name: SsoSecurityPolicyDescription
data.value: Enforce department-wide compliance controls alongside SSO:

data.name: SsoSecurityPolicyRestrictLogin
data.value: Restrict login to SSO only (disable passwords)

data.name: SsoSecurityPolicyIpRestrict
data.value: Limit logins to specific IP CIDR ranges

data.name: SsoDiscoveryUrlCalloutDescription
data.value: The Resgrid mobile app uses this URL to discover your SSO settings before showing the login screen. Share it with your mobile team if needed.

data.name: SsoNoConfigurationsWarning
data.value: No SSO configurations yet. Use the buttons above to add OIDC or SAML 2.0.

data.name: SsoDeleteConfirmMessage
data.value: Are you sure you want to delete the {0} SSO configuration? This cannot be undone.

data.name: SsoEditEnableDescription
data.value: Only one configuration per provider type is active at a time.

data.name: SsoEditAllowLocalLoginDescription
data.value: When checked, users can still log in with username & password in addition to SSO. Disable this together with the Security Policy's Require SSO flag to enforce SSO-only login.

data.name: SsoEditAutoProvisionDescription
data.value: Automatically create a Resgrid account when a user authenticates via SSO for the first time and no matching email is found. Leave off to require manual invitation first.

data.name: SsoEditScimEnableDescription
data.value: Allows your IdP to automatically create/update/deactivate members. After saving, go to the SCIM Setup page to generate a bearer token.

data.name: SsoEditDefaultRankDescription
data.value: Optional. Applied only when Auto-Provision creates a new member.

data.name: SsoEditOidcInfoAlert
data.value: Where to find these values: In your IdP, register Resgrid as a Public Client (PKCE, no client secret required for mobile) or Web App (with secret for server-side flows). Copy the Client ID and Issuer URL from the registered application.

data.name: SsoEditAuthorityDescription
data.value: Examples: Entra ID: https://login.microsoftonline.com/{tenant-id}/v2.0 | Okta: https://{your-domain}.okta.com/oauth2/default | Google: https://accounts.google.com

data.name: SsoEditClientIdDescription
data.value: The public client identifier assigned by your IdP. Safe to display — not a secret.

data.name: SsoEditClientSecretDescription
data.value: Encrypted at rest using your department-specific key. Leave blank if using PKCE (mobile/SPA — no secret needed).

data.name: SsoEditClientSecretKeepExisting
data.value: Leave blank to keep the existing secret unchanged.

data.name: SsoEditSamlInfoAlert
data.value: Where to find these values: In your IdP, create a new SAML application. Enter the SP Entity ID and ACS URL shown below into your IdP, then paste the IdP metadata URL or certificate back here.

data.name: SsoEditSpEntityIdLabel
data.value: SP Entity ID (enter this into your IdP)

data.name: SsoEditAcsUrlLabel
data.value: ACS URL (Assertion Consumer Service — enter this into your IdP)

data.name: SsoEditAcsUrlNote
data.value: This URL uses an encrypted department token — never exposes your plain department code.

data.name: SsoEditEntityIdEditableNote
data.value: Must match exactly what you entered in the IdP.

data.name: SsoEditMetadataUrlNote
data.value: Resgrid will periodically fetch this URL to stay up to date with IdP certificates.

data.name: SsoEditAcsUrlStoredNote
data.value: Auto-filled from the generated URL above. Modify only if you configured a different ACS URL in your IdP.

data.name: SsoEditIdpCertNote
data.value: Encrypted at rest. Leave blank to keep the existing certificate.

data.name: SsoEditSigningKeyNote
data.value: Encrypted at rest. Leave blank if your IdP does not require signed requests.

data.name: SsoEditAttrMapDescription
data.value: Map claim names your IdP sends to the Resgrid user fields. Leave blank to use the standard claim URIs automatically. The value is the claim name as emitted by your IdP.

data.name: SsoEditAttrMapJsonNote
data.value: Must be valid JSON. Use the quick-fill buttons on the right.

data.name: SsoEditQuickFillDescription
data.value: Click to auto-fill the mapping JSON with known defaults for your IdP.

data.name: ScimSetupTokenWarningTitle
data.value: Important — Copy your SCIM Bearer Token Now

data.name: ScimSetupTokenWarningBody
data.value: This token is displayed only once and cannot be retrieved again. Copy it immediately and paste it into your identity provider's SCIM configuration. If you lose it, click Rotate Token to generate a new one.

data.name: ScimSetupTokenEncryptedNote
data.value: This token is stored encrypted in the Resgrid database using your department-specific encryption key.

data.name: ScimSetupRotateTokenNote
data.value: Rotating generates a new token and invalidates the old one.

data.name: ScimSetupRotateTokenConfirm
data.value: Are you sure? Any existing SCIM integration will break until you update the token in your IdP.

data.name: ScimSetupConnectorDescription
data.value: Enter these values into your identity provider's SCIM provisioning configuration.

data.name: ScimSetupGenericHeader
data.value: Any SCIM 2.0 compatible client can be configured with the following:

data.name: SecurityPolicyNoSsoWarning
data.value: No active SSO configuration. You can configure password policies below, but Require SSO cannot be enabled until you have an active SSO configuration.

data.name: SecurityPolicyRequireMfaNote
data.value: Members who have not enrolled in MFA will be prompted to do so on next login.

data.name: SecurityPolicyRequireSsoWarning
data.value: Warning: Enabling this blocks all username/password logins. Ensure at least one admin has tested SSO login successfully before enabling.

data.name: SecurityPolicyIpRangesNote
data.value: One CIDR block per line, or comma-separated. Empty = allow all. Logins from outside these ranges will be denied.

data.name: SecurityPolicyDataClassNote
data.value: Used for compliance reporting and audit logs.

data.name: SecurityPolicyPasswordInfoAlert
data.value: Password policies apply to local (non-SSO) logins only. If you enable Require SSO above, these settings have no effect.

data.name: SecurityPolicyPasswordExpirationNote
data.value: 0 = passwords never expire. 90 is typical for CUI environments.

data.name: SecurityPolicyMinPasswordLengthNote
data.value: 0 = system default (8). NIST recommends 12+; CUI requires 14+.

data.name: SecurityPolicyPasswordComplexityNote
data.value: Enforces at least one uppercase letter, one digit, and one special character.

data.name: SecurityPolicyCannotEnableRequireSso
data.value: Cannot enable SSO-only login: no active SSO configuration exists. Create and enable an SSO configuration first.
